name: inaccessibility
content:
inaccessibility noun [U]
(DIFFICULTY OF REACHING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of being very difficult or impossible to travel to or to reach: Most of the forests are being cut down, but this region has been protected by its inaccessibility. Security at the site is based largely on its inaccessibility.
More examplesFewer examplesThe inaccessibility of the ranch helped preserve the hundreds of ancient ruins there, sprawling across thousands of acres.The wilderness region's inaccessibility has discouraged all but the sturdiest of hikers from exploring its wonders.The inaccessibility of the drought region means that one third of the relief money goes on transport.

inaccessibility noun [U]
(DIFFICULTY OF KNOWING/UNDERSTANDING )
the quality of being difficult to understand or get close to: She has a withdrawn quality and an air of inaccessibility. Constituents complained about her inaccessibility. See
inaccessible
More examplesFewer examplesHer mystique is based on her rare appearances and media inaccessibility. Inaccessibility won Garbo more publicity than a thousand interviews.His inaccessibility has been a problem during his tenure at the school.
